dataset.title: SBC LTER: Meteorological and sea surface data from the R/V Pt.

address.deliveryPoint: Department of Ecology, Evolution and Marine Biology
Department of Ecology, Evolution and Marine Biology

section.para: The data described here were collected on LTER01 which took place from 2001-03-20 to 2001-03-26 on the RV Pt. Sur. Cruises have been conducted in the Santa Barbara Channel, California, USA, 3-4 times per year since March, 2001 and are approximately 7 days in length.

section.title: There are 2 basic types of measurements:
section.para: Underway measurements: fluorometry, salinity and temperature are collected at a depth of 3m with a flow-through system which also includes continuous atmospheric climate measurements.
Underway acoustic dopler current profiles were collected using a NB 150kHz ADCP.

intellectualRights.para: This work is dedicated to the public domain under the Creative Commons Universal 1.0 Public Domain Dedication. To view a copy of this dedication, visit https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Santa Barbara Channel: Santa Barbara Channel: SBCHAN: The Channel is roughly defined on the north by the coastline of mainland California, USA, on the east by the outlet of the Santa Clara River, on the south by the Santa Barbara Channel Islands, and on the west by Point Arguello.

contact.positionName: Information Manager, Santa Barbara Coastal LTER

protocol.title: R/V Pt. Sur Underway Data Acquisition System

creator.organizationName: Moss Landing Marine Labs, Marine Operations

methodStep.instrumentation: Meteorological: Eppley Precision Infrared Radiometer (PIR) Pyrgeometer which measures longwave radiation in the infrared electromagnetic range 4 to 50 micrometers
Meteorological: RM Young Barometric Pressure Sensor 61201
Sea Surface Sensors: WetLabs 25cm path length CStar Transmissometer
Sea Surface Sensors: SBE21 Seacat Thermosalinograph w/ remote temperature sensor located in ship's hull
Sea Surface Sensors: ISUS V3 Nitrate Sensor (project-supplied, not standard ship equipment
Navigation: Ashtec ADU2-GPS-based three dimensional position determination, real-time heading, pitch and roll
ADCP: Teledyne RDI Ocean Surveyor 75khz LTA

description.para: Data were collected from calendar dates 2016-03-01 to 2016-11-30 inclusive. The study area included the city Anchorage, Alaska and surrounding suburbs.

samplingDescription.para: Six traps were set in a transect at each location.

project.title: Santa Barbara Coastal Long Term Ecological Research Project

address.deliveryPoint: Bren School of Environmental Science and Management
Institute for Computational Earth System Science

section.para: The primary research objective of the Santa Barbara Coastal LTER is to investigate the importance of land and ocean processes in structuring giant kelp (Macrocystis pyrifera) forest ecosystems. As in many temperate regions, the shallow rocky reefs in the Santa Barbara Channel, California, are dominated by giant kelp forests. Because of their close proximity to shore, kelp forests are influenced by physical and biological processes occurring on land as well as in the open ocean. SBC LTER research focuses on measuring and modeling the patterns, transport, and processing of material constituents (e.g., nutrients, carbon, sediment, organisms, and pollutants) from terrestrial watersheds and the coastal ocean to these reefs. Specifically, we are examining the effects of these material inputs on the primary production of kelp, and the population dynamics, community structure, and trophic interactions of kelp forest ecosystems.

dataTable.entityDescription: Measurments of sea surface (3m) and meteorological parameters collected using the shipboard underway data acquisition system

dataTable.additionalInfo: This data table was designed as a simple one headerline, comma delimited text file.

stmml:unit.name: dimensionless
stmml:unit.stmml:description: a designation asserting the absence of an associated unit

stmml:unit.name: microeinsteinPerMeterSquaredPerSecond
stmml:unit.stmml:description: PAR irradiance unit, Seabird 911. 1Ein = energy of 1 mole photons

stmml:unit.name: micromolePerLiter
stmml:unit.stmml:description: commonly used for concentration of some chemical constituents of natural water bodies, e.g., nutrients. It has the same magnitude as micromolar, but micromolar can only be used for a dissolved constituent

stmml:unit.name: nominalDay
stmml:unit.stmml:description: one day excluding leap seconds, 86400 seconds

stmml:unit.name: percent
stmml:unit.stmml:description: ratio of two quantities as percent composition (1:100)

stmml:unit.name: siemensPerMeter
stmml:unit.stmml:description: siemens per meter (electrolytic conductivity of a solution)
